briefTitle: Dopamine Versus Norepinephrine for the Treatment of Vasopressor Dependent Septic Shock
officialTitle: Dopamine Versus Norepinephrine for the Treatment of Vasopressor Dependent Septic Shock
summary: We are performing a prospective, randomized, controlled trial of dopamine versus norepinephrine for septic shock. The trial will enroll patients with suspected or documented site of infection and having 2 out of the three SIRS criteria. Patients will also be receiving standard of care, early-goal directed therapy including but not limited to fluid resuscitation, appropriate and early antibiotics, source control and evaluation for drotrecogin alpha where deemed appropriate, while being supported for septic shock.

primaryOutcome.measure: Efficacy and Safety of Dopamine Versus Norepinephrine in Septic Shock
